website_summaries.verdict: An effective grabber like this one offers users several ways to pick up objects, not just a set of pinching jaws. We appreciate the versatility offered by a magnetic tip and metal hook.
pros: Works well as a dressing aid
Metal stud can be used to hook clothing or bags
Plastic clip attaches to walkers, wheelchairs and canes
cons: Not ideal for picking up small, flat objects (coins, magazines, etc.)
Lightweight construction is not meant for heavy duty use

customer_reviews.title: Buy a better reacher
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the worst grabbers I have ever used. It's flimsy with a shape on the pick up end that makes it impossible to slide under a flat item, like a magazine or piece of mail, to pick it up. The claws also tend to pass each other because the alignment is so loose. There is also a small hard nub on the corner of the handle that pokes the side of your hand when you are trying to use it. I have used other light grabbers, so the "featherweight" is no excuse. This is poorly made and pretty useless. Spend a little more and get something that works.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Ratings do not match up with product I received
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure where all these high rating reviews come from? I found that the product I received does not match any of the good product reviews left for this item. Product is cheaply made and flimsy. The grip is not that secure. Holding the product makes it feel that its cheaply made and it is. The handle is way too small. This item will be returned in the morning. I would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: joe mancuso

customer_reviews.title: Love this grabber
customer_reviews.text: I recently had serious back surgery which resulted in absolutely no bending, lifting or twisting for several more months. My OT suggested that I purchase a grabber to that I could pick items up that I may drop ~ this grabber is a life-saver!! This is my aide for sure to help me as when one tries hard not to drop something, it always happens. So my reason, for loving this grabber!!
customer_reviews.author: Mormor

customer_reviews.title: A great tool for those who have physical limitations!
customer_reviews.text: This has come in so very helpful during my recovery from total hip replacement. It is easy to use, attaches to a walker, and has assisted me in so many ways. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Doeringer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Had back surgery. Only need it for a couple of months. If you need one every day, or are in a wheel chair. Spend more money. Super light weight. Magnet is very weak. It could not pick up a small bolt or a lightweight letter opener. I worked to pick up trash, small items I dropped on the floor. I use it to get clothes I dropped on the floor and could not bend over to get. The grip is weak. It could barely lift a box of cereal off of a high shelf. You get what you pay for. For me, it’s all I needed. If you are disabled. Keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch McGaughey

customer_reviews.title: Does the job/would recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I like this reacher because it's one of the shorter ones-it makes it easier to handle. The drawback, of course, is that it doesn't reach as far as a longer one, but I really don't need something like that. It's lightweight but doesn't seem sturdy. The grip is good, the width could be wider to accommodate bigger items. All in all I am satisfied with my purchase and would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Janice_V

customer_reviews.title: NO INSTRUCTIONS:A Picture is no worth a 1000 words
customer_reviews.text: Although I like the idea of the item, there are no instructions and no pictures labeling the parts so you can try to figure out how to use it. The pictures online do not help either. I could have saved money and paid less because other than grab, I don't know how to use the features. I am new to having to use assisted items.
customer_reviews.author: PAF

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Just had a back fusion and this helps a lot when you aren’t able to bend for 3 months it’s amazing the things you have to figure out how to do. It would be great if it was extendable. I am 5ft 5” and it doesn’t reach the ground so I think that’s a feature that would be great to add. It is very lightweight and seems to be well built
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed in this product. It was recommended to me at the hospital and, apparently, I didn't really put the product to the test before purchasing. The grabbing portion, or the end of the contraption, constantly gets caught. In other words, when attempting to pick up the item I need, the grabbing mechanism essentially over-grabs and gets stuck on itself and I have to unstick the bloody thing and try to pick the item up again. And, if you've dropped your smartphone and are trying to pick it up, this device is utterly useless. Luckily, I haven't needed this product as frequently as others might, but I'm going to return it if I can. Again, truly a disappointing product.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t align when closed so returned.
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived and the grabber part didn’t align properly. Maybe it was damaged in shipment ? Every time is closed it wouldn’t be in the groove. It did not look very well made either so gave me a good reason to return it. After seeing the quality I chose not to reorder.
customer_reviews.author: Nikkei

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight grabber, but not for heavier items
customer_reviews.text: I got this grabber because I'm short and can't easily reach to the bottom of my top-load washing machine. This grabber does a great job pulling out lighter items, but doesn't quite have the gripping power to pull heavier things such as towels fully out.
customer_reviews.author: ShoshTrvls

customer_reviews.title: If you are purchasing this model for the clip-on feature be sure it fits your walker
customer_reviews.text: A little flimsy. Not as sturdy as I had expected. I purchased this grabber because it has a clip that is meant to allow it to be attached to a walker. However this clip doesn't fit onto the walker I have. This is unfortunate. Now that I am home from the hospital and using both the walker and the grabber, I have found that it would have been very helpful for the grabber to attach to the walker.
customer_reviews.author: g girl

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product --- the Grabber
customer_reviews.text: These grabbers are the greatest things --- I have one in each room of the house and use them every day. The magnetic tip on the end is great for picking up things like paper clips, etc. The only thing I wish --- that the grabber was able to hang up when not in use --- the little thing that won't hang up is of no use to me. Wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: D Williams

customer_reviews.title: Bionic woman
customer_reviews.text: I love my new grabber. My old one would lock up and it was the only thing I didn’t like about it. This new grabber is awesome and has a clip that I can secure it on my walker bar. It makes me want to have one in every room but I don’t need to because of the secure clip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good length, good holding power, light weight.
customer_reviews.text: Have bought several styles of grippers over the years. Multiple back, hip and knee surgeries make touching my feet difficult. I use a griped to dress, put on shoes and socks, pick thing up from the floor, etc. I was looking for a shorter length because my shoulder hurts to pull back too far. This one is sturdy, a good length and seems to hold on to items well. The grip is the important part. It holds on to stuff better than most.
customer_reviews.author: Karna Esry

customer_reviews.title: Looks were deceiving
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace one that I used every day for 3 years. It looked the same however the handle grip was bulkier and although still light weight it was heavier than my previous one. Every ounce makes a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Janice W

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what a short person needs!
customer_reviews.text: What did I ever do without this gadget? A tall person built cabinets in the house that I bought. I was always getting out a step stool to reach the high places. I'm pleased that the grabber can be positioned so exactly and if I'm careful, even the glassware is safe. This is a short person's delight.
customer_reviews.author: N. McBride

customer_reviews.title: Great aid for dressing and undressing!
customer_reviews.text: Great Reacher for helping one get dressed. I use it to put on underpanties, slacks and shoes and for reaching many other item that have fallen on the floor or that are to high up!
customer_reviews.author: Lois Masse

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful Grabber
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it hooks into my wheelchair - because it goes with me everywhere I go, it is always there when I need it. Also picks up fairly large, if not too heavy, articles, so saves on stretching these tired shoulders and arms!
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This product works well for what it was designed to do. In my shop, there are some small objects is does not "grab" but on the positive side, the magnet works well, which I didn't have before.
customer_reviews.author: Joel H. Horne

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: The grabber works exactly the way I hoped. My only complaint is that the clip to hold it on my cane broke the first time I tried to put it on the cane. That limits its use because it's another thing to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for multiple tasks when you have back and hip pain
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool to pick up drop objects then to take off or help put on my socks and shoes. It is a great multi use tool for anyone but especially for those of use with back and hip issue that prevent us from bending and stooping.
customer_reviews.author: Jeepman4x4

customer_reviews.title: Best one around
customer_reviews.text: I was introduced to this product at a rehab center and so glad they used it. I had to get one before I came home and carry it with me all the time. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybug1

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Pay a little extra for this one! I bought a cheaper one first that doesn't work well at all! This one picks up very tiny objects with no problem!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl S Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE IN SO MANY WAYS.
customer_reviews.text: The best thing ever purchased after back surgery. I constantly used to then to the left and to the right each side of my bed, there is always something just a little Out Of Reach! Not anymore I love it so much I intend to get a 36 inch. There are two types love handles and the end for picking up items. This would always be my first choice the second one will be Pinchers in the shape of a horseshoe which I will rate at a later point in time.
customer_reviews.author: karolyn

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s intended for.
customer_reviews.text: I had to untie and reset the cord to get the claw arm to move correctly. Not a big deal, however. This item has no suction feature, nor was I expecting it to.
customer_reviews.author: Pickle Ball Forever

customer_reviews.title: Works well for grabbing things without bending over
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the reacher is a very handy tool for my husband who recently had hip replacement surgery. The only issue we've had is that it falls off the walker too easily, but that might be due to the fact that our walker is older and has thick handles.
customer_reviews.author: Carole

customer_reviews.title: Defiant asset for those who had back surgery
customer_reviews.text: I had spinal surgery and the nurses at the hospital recommended this to avoid bending. There’s no way I would have been able to do laundry without this
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great for tiny to large pick ups
customer_reviews.text: This is best grabber. Can pick up a pill to something larger. Not sturdy enough to lift cans Live the magnet on the end. Great for paper clips, Bobby pins, needles etc.
customer_reviews.author: Linoa

customer_reviews.title: Measure for correct length before ordering.
customer_reviews.text: The shorter 26 inch Reacher was too short as have back issues and had to lean over to pick up item. It does grab most items except very flat papers. Will order 32 inch.
customer_reviews.author: Frustrating

customer_reviews.title: Quite useful.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good reacher, and the magnetic end can be useful. This is my second one upstairs and down stairs. The post came out of the older one and I had also adjust the cord to tighten it.
customer_reviews.author: John Henricks

customer_reviews.title: Great little helper!
customer_reviews.text: I’m really pleased with my grabber and when I’m not using it it hooks right on my rollator! Handy helper!
customer_reviews.author: Beverly B.

customer_reviews.title: Helpful item
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my dad. He loves it. It helps him while he’s recovering from his surgery and can not use his legs. Helps with picking stuff up if items fall to the floor. The most important use to him is that it can help with pulling up his sock when they start to slipp off. Especially when wearing those non skid socks lol.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: It grabs anything
customer_reviews.text: It does, it grabs and reaches anything. These were gifts for my friends. I've had one for 5 years. IRMA DICKINSON
customer_reviews.author: irma dickinson

customer_reviews.title: I was recently in an accident that disabled the left ...
customer_reviews.text: I was recently in an accident that disabled the left side of my body. This product came in handy. I've owned it for a month and a half and it's held up.
customer_reviews.author: James F. Hale III

customer_reviews.title: Well Made STURDY Grip
customer_reviews.text: After returning a kit with flimsy products, I ordered this reacher. It is well made, sturdy, has an excellent gripper at the end, and is easy to use. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CoCoLatte

customer_reviews.title: This device is a great help
customer_reviews.text: This device was recommended by my occupational therapist to allow me to pickup things from the floor or in cabinets that I cannot reach while sitting in a wheelchair.
customer_reviews.author: InspectorK

customer_reviews.title: This grabber rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a variety of grabbes for several years and RMS is my favorite. This model is slghtly diffefent from the usual p;incer but works well.
customer_reviews.author: pap Beel

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: After hip replacement surgery, I was told to get a device to avoid having to bend over. I am pleased with the product and it really came in handy during the first two months after my surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Pohaku

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: though not heavy duty It works well and does what I needed it to do
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Brewton

customer_reviews.title: It was not as sturdy as I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: mine did not have magnets--that was disappointing, but it is a must-have tool after hip surgery or when you can't bend or reach. It was not as sturdy as I was expecting, but it is still working, so I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: ER

customer_reviews.title: Needed after back surgery
customer_reviews.text: Following back surgery (decompression and fusion), I was not allowed to bend, lift, or twist. I needed this tool to reach for objects that I dropped and also to help me dress myself. Thankfully, the occupational therapists at the rehab where I spent 2 weeks, told me which grabber to order and I am totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: An extension of my arm
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy the assist it gives me to get things that are dropped on the floor, and reach some everyday items because I'm in a power chair all day. Well constructed, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Nice grabber
customer_reviews.text: I recently broke my leg and it seems I am dropping things more often and can't reach down to pick things up so this "Reacher" is very helpful. I need to learn how to pick up the smaller items but I did manage to pick up a pill I dropped so that was a nice feat!
customer_reviews.author: Elvy

customer_reviews.title: Loose string now completely detached. Can't use product.
customer_reviews.text: String was extremely loose upon arrival. I tightened per instructions I received from customer service but after a few weeks it came loose again and then completely came out if slot and I was not able to thread it under the roller to re-attach it. Very disappointed. I had one while in Physical Therapy that was much more durable.
customer_reviews.author: William V.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: They were a gift but I have heard rave reviews from the recipients
customer_reviews.author: linda harrings

customer_reviews.title: It’s light weight, works for picking up items off the floor.
customer_reviews.text: It works well for picking up items off the floor. I can play with my dog with it because I could throw a ball for her. It also is able to pick up small items, which I didn’t expect. I haven’t tried it for picking up items over my head yet. I don’t use it for that..
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Great reacher
customer_reviews.text: Just love my reacher! I plan to purchase more---one for upstairs is a must. Especially great when you have difficulty bending over. I do not see a magnet. That would be a nice addition. Cannot be without my reacher now!
customer_reviews.author: Kat M

customer_reviews.title: Great reaching tool.
customer_reviews.text: Good tyight grip, easy to use, nice 'hook' for hanging items or getting hooks down - I used mine for hanging windchimes.
customer_reviews.author: Carol H

customer_reviews.title: Good grabbers
customer_reviews.text: These are good sturdy grabbers and make my wife's life easier.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ricks

customer_reviews.title: I was looking for something to help pull up my ...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to help pull up my socks - this doesn't work very well got that because the end is too floppy. It does work well for reaching other very light items, but not particularly helpful got my main purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Horton

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: purchased for my wife who uses a walker. Very helpful to pick item off floor and helps with dressing. The clip designed to attached does not work well. Grabber always falls off when attached to walker.
customer_reviews.author: web/cin

customer_reviews.title: Great "Grabber"
customer_reviews.text: I had back surgery and was told not to bend, twist or pick up anything that weighed more than 5-10 lbs. The "Grabber" was exceptionally helpful for several chores. It helped me get dressed. It helped pick up light weight items on the floor. And it help do some laundry. Great Product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great grabber...
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for one that was lost in a move. Works fine and lasts a long time. Never had an issue (8 years) with the first one, and do not anticipate trouble with this one...
customer_reviews.author: Jerry. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: the end that opens does not open very wide.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that the mouth of the grabber opened so little. It barely grabs my one pound jars of FLOSSINE.
customer_reviews.author: SisterSinful

customer_reviews.title: Becoming independent
customer_reviews.text: Just had hip replacement and this tool is helping me become more independent. I use it daily to dress for day and then to get ready for bed. Wish I had had it before surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Judythe Hummel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just as expected and extremely useful and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Susie J.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use picks up everything I just had hip replacement and was not able to bend I still use it
customer_reviews.author: Diana Lynn Vaiano

customer_reviews.title: Best to supplement the "rubber suction cup" style grabbers with ...
customer_reviews.text: Works ok. Best to supplement the "rubber suction cup" style grabbers with one like this. Jaw was a bit small when fully opened.
customer_reviews.author: R Knight

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget!
customer_reviews.text: It has been a lifesaver after spinal fusion surgery. I never dropped so many things in my life!! It could be a little story/sturdier, but it wasn’t expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn W.

customer_reviews.title: 😃
customer_reviews.text: This product does everything i need it to do. The magnet function is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Dan A

customer_reviews.title: Its a winner
customer_reviews.text: Exactly right. Better than the ones you can buy at the store. Immediately started using it and thankful for it
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tool to be used by my mother in law. She is having issues picking things up and I thought that I could help her by buying this product for her. She seems to like it and is happy for the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Checked it out, works great and has small magnet!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for myself, however, my mother and father in law need it more than I do, giving it to them for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: J Sorbi

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a family member after hip replacement surgery. It works very well and they plan on using even after they recover because it's very handy to have.
customer_reviews.author: Kay A. Cates

customer_reviews.title: This is good for picking up very light items only.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it’s light weight. I don’t see where there is suction power.
customer_reviews.author: Knpokey

customer_reviews.title: Received in time and in good condition
customer_reviews.text: Product was received in time and in good condition. I bought it for hubby and he has only used it briefly. He thinks it looks nice and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Mao Ling

customer_reviews.title: excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as extra for one i have used for several years. Is of same construction and utility and is extreamly usefull and durable. Good product and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Tinley titen

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful.
customer_reviews.text: The is a great help for people that struggle to pick up small items.
customer_reviews.author: KRP

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Started to stick closed after two month. Bought the reacher with suction cups...better design.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Really great product to help older people
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my mother to help her pick up things from the floor without her having to bend over. She loves this product!
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: Alot better than one that doesn't have a clip to attach to a walker. But the clip is a little too small so it doesn't form a firm enough grip and pops off if you brush by something.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Latman

customer_reviews.title: Great help after fusion
customer_reviews.text: This works great for me. Had spinal fusion of L4-5 so no bending right now. The clamp on the end seems weak, but so far it has worked just fine. And my solution to this is I am thinking of buying a backup in case it does break. I really do like the product.
customer_reviews.author: peregrine

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Length is perfect, standing or sitting for my 5’4” frame.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Meister

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Good for reaching when back was just out of surgery
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had an about this one
customer_reviews.text: The string stretched out. I had a surgery not to pick up more than 20 pounds or bend down. This gripper only works well to pick up paper or plastic bags.
customer_reviews.author: the  scotties

customer_reviews.title: can't pick up anything substantial
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband without reading the reviews because it was recommended by Amazon. Big mistake. Can't pick up books which is what we desperately need. And one can't pick up anything very wide. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: cindy

customer_reviews.title: Not long enough to touch the ground
customer_reviews.text: Product is as described, just forewarning if you can not bend over and are using this to pick things up off the ground it is NOT long enough. At least not at 5 foot 5 inches or taller.
customer_reviews.author: Kara Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Needed an extra reacher after spinal fusion surgery. This is comparable to the one I received upon hospital discharge. I don’t leave home without it.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia W Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Needs more work!
customer_reviews.text: Did not like it! Not much magnet, got hung on everything! Grip snap broke! Too clumbsy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: was satisfied with it
customer_reviews.text: Had purchased this product before, was satisfied with it. Re-ordered it, and received a canary yellow product, jaw opened only three inches, trigger mis-shaped. Be ashamed to be seen in public with it. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reacher
customer_reviews.text: Had this reacher for years after my wifes back surgery and it was very convenient. Once it broke had a difficult time replacing it. Happy to find it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime J Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t grab well!
customer_reviews.text: This product broke within 2 days of use! It sucks! Supplier please tell me how to return for a refund!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best I’ve ever used!
customer_reviews.text: It’s shorter and lightweight and has a strong grip which all make for a far better grabber than others I’ve used.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: If I reach for something there is a good chance that it the head will turn and drop ...
customer_reviews.text: It isn’t very stable. If I reach for something there is a good chance that it the head will turn and drop what I’m trying to reach.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Paryse

customer_reviews.title: I use it to help me dress.
customer_reviews.text: I gave the reacher a low suction rating because it isn't designed that way, no suction cups. I have a reacher/grabber with suction cups but it doesn't work for pulling up my pants like this one.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD C EKSTEDT

customer_reviews.title: Easy squeezeee
customer_reviews.text: The handle function is very smooth and old hands can squeeze and hold items and move/pick them up them easily.
customer_reviews.author: Linda A.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected. It works well for people with limited abilities to reach or bend to get things. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: New hip
customer_reviews.text: I used this after having a hip replacement. I used it to pick up whatever I dropped as well as putting on my clothes and shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Philippa Motley

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Long after my back surgery and recovery I am still using this tool !
customer_reviews.author: Norma Smith-Davis

customer_reviews.title: Must have device for folks with physical limitations as a ...
customer_reviews.text: Must have device for folks with physical limitations as a result of surgery or injury.. Don't be fooled by cheap dollar store devices.. They don't hold up and cant keep up with the demands that this one can..
customer_reviews.author: Roy H. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: It’s sturdy and useful.
customer_reviews.text: I’m recovering from a herniated disc on my lower back, this has been a huge help! Unfortunately my son just injured his knee so I bought the longer one for him while he recovers.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Beatriz Nasr

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I have a reacher similar to this one in every room of my house. I ordered this one for my car, to hold my golf shoes while I stand and put them on.
customer_reviews.author: golfer

customer_reviews.title: Long overdue!
customer_reviews.text: Light and powerful. Much better than the old grabber I have had for years.
customer_reviews.author: frank repplier

customer_reviews.title: Best picker upper!
customer_reviews.text: 80 year old dad prefers this picker upper to any other!
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Well Thought out for Use by individuals that have lost the ability or never had it !!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The magnet inserted into front of stationary pick-up area was FANTASTIC for a Disabled Senior !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: David R Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. This model type was recommended by my Physical Therapist. Have used to pick up papers, items with handles.
customer_reviews.author: PAT GROSSANO

customer_reviews.title: Great tool when recovering from hospital stay
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my father in law, he loves it .
customer_reviews.author: Lisa P.

customer_reviews.title: A handy pickup tool for picking up objects without straining, especially after surgery.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this grabber/reacher for my pending hip replacement to prevent strain on my hip. I’m satisfied with it and will use it lots in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Laquita Corban

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I have had surgery on my leg that makes it difficult to put on shoes and this helps alot.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

product_meta.title: RMS Featherweight The Original Reacher (26-inch)
feature_bullets: 26" Long Reacher Grabber. Our reacher extends your reach by 26 inches. You can reach higher and lower than normal without having to strain yourself.
Ergonomic Handle & Trigger: The handle and trigger are contoured to fit the shape of your hand, making it easier to hold and pull without slipping.

Wide Claw & Magnetic Tip: You can easily pick up lightweight metal objects with magnetic tip on our reacher. The jaws of the reacher open wide and feature textured rubber grips to help hold objects in place while grabbing them.
Yellow clip fastens reachers to canes, walkers, wheelchairs and hospital bed rails to keep them nearby.

Lightweight Design: Our Reacher Grabber is made of high quality, lightweight aluminum. It is sturdy and it's perfect for those with arthritis who have trouble using traditionally designed heavy tools.
